{{groovy}} import org.json.JSONObject
/* * List documents * ----------- * * This sheet get (in JSON format) all the documents that a user can access in a defined space. * * Author: Jean SIMARD (jean.simard@xwiki.com) */ /* * Create the document * ----- * * The function will create a JSON containing a list of documents accessible by the current users concerning a specific space. * * @param spacename The name of the specific space * @return A string in the JSON format containing the 'space' (the spacename) and 'documents' (a list of documents) */ public String getSpaceDocumentList(spacename) { myjson = new JSONObject().put("space", spacename) query_select = "select distinct doc.fullName" query_from = "from XWikiDocument doc, BaseObject as obj, StringListProperty as prop1, StringListProperty prop2" query_where_prop1 = "obj.id = prop1.id.id and prop1.id.name = 'users' and prop1.textValue like '%" + xcontext.user + "'" query_where_prop2 = "obj.id = prop2.id.id and prop2.id.name = 'groups' and prop2.textValue like '%XWiki.ENTAllGroup%'" query_where = "where doc.space = '" + spacename + "' and doc.fullName = obj.name and obj.className = 'XWiki.XWikiRights' and ( ( " + query_where_prop1 + " ) or ( " + query_where_prop2 + " ) )" query = query_select + " " + query_from + " " + query_where results = services.query.hql(query).addFilter('hidden').addFilter('unique').execute() documentlist = [] for(documentname in results) { documentlist.add(documentname) } myjson.put("documents", documentlist) return myjson.toString() } print(getSpaceDocumentList(request.getParameter('spacename'))) {{/groovy}}
